description: From Middle English misfallen, equivalent to mis- +‎ fall. Cognate with Dutch misvallen (“to misfall, miss in falling, displease, miscarry”), German missfallen (“to displease”), Icelandic misfalla (“to misuse”).

entries.meaning: A mishap; accident; bad luck; misfortune.
examples: But alas! an unlooked- for misfall has occurred."

verbs.description: misfall (third-person singular simple present misfalls, present participle misfalling, simple past misfell, past participle misfallen)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To befall badly or incorrectly; happen unfortunately (to); mishappen; turn out badly.
examples: [...] let us abide together that, one with the counsel and that other with the deed, then may there nothing misfall to usward.
